author: A.J. Mastrangelo
title: Local
text: {p}{strong}From Nick Russo, Storm Team 10 Meteorologist:{/strong}{/p}{p}Clear and cold tonight with lows in the upper 20s as winds ease up. The winds pick back up on Sunday, resulting in a high fire danger again. A Red Flag Warning is in effect from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m. on Sunday across all of Southern New England. High temperatures Sunday will be a touch warmer in the upper 50s to near 60. Expect increasing clouds on Sunday ahead of an approaching area of low pressure which will bring light rain after sunset Sunday night. Not much rain is expected with that system, only around a quarter inch in most spots.{ }{/p}{p}Monday will be the warmest day of the week as sunshine returns and high temperatures reach the mid to upper 60s. It turns cooler starting Tuesday with highs back in the 50s. Wednesday and Thursday will be chilly as highs struggle to make it out of the 40s. Our next chance for a few light rain showers arrives Thursday afternoon.{/p}{p}{strong}Check the latest weather stories for Southern New England on the {a href=\"https://turnto10.com/weather/weather-blog\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://turnto10.com/weather/weather-blog\"}Storm Team 10 Weather Blog.{/a}{/strong}{/p}{p}Tonight: Clear and cold. Low: 29{/p}{p}Sunday: Increasing clouds with light rain likely after sunset. High: 58{/p}{p}Monday: Early clouds, increasing sun, a bit milder. High: 67{/p}{p}Tuesday: Mostly sunny. High: 57{/p}{p}Wednesday: Mainly sunny. High: 48{/p}{p}Thursday: Mostly cloudy with a few showers possible later the day. High: 50{/p}{p}Friday: Mostly cloudy. Small risk of a shower. High: 52{/p}{p}Saturday: Mostly sunny.
